intro: Phyllanthus narayanswamii, commonly known as the Narayanswamy phyllanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions. It has a compact growth habit with fleshy stems and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
